block.p: Sarah Alice Anne Safer, the daughter of Jane and Morley Safer of New York, and Alexander Bakal, a son of Yevgenya Bakal of North Hollywood, Calif., and the late Vasily Bakal, were married in a civil ceremony on Friday in Ravello, Italy, the town where the couple became engaged. Mayor Secondo Amalfitano of Ravello officiated at town hall. Today, Rabbi Michael Marmur is to perform a religious ceremony at the Villa Cimbrone in Ravello.

Ms. Safer, 30, who is keeping her name, is a freelance journalist. She graduated from Brown University and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia University. Her father is the correspondent and co-editor of the CBS program ''60 Minutes.'' Her mother is a museum consultant based in Manhattan. She works primarily with the Fund for Arts and Culture in Central and Eastern Europe, which assists arts and cultural institutions in the former Eastern bloc.

Mr. Bakal, 35, is a co-owner of Orion Partners, an investment banking concern in New York. He graduated summa cum laude from Harvard University. The bridegroom and his family emigrated to the United States from Moldavia, then part of the Soviet Union, in 1979. The bridegroom's mother, a former chemical engineer in the Soviet Union, retired as a bookkeeper for the Hilton Corporation in Los Angeles. His father was a hairdresser in the Soviet Union and later worked as a bell captain at Le Parc, a hotel in West Hollywood, Calif.
